content.content: In short   In the first month of 2023 DUX team has been working on a technical Proof-of-Concept application for the SubDAO app project (ie. one of the Pregame products and blockers for Early Game launch).   We’ve also progressed with its visual & UX design and started engaging with relevant stakeholders on the design front.   The first usable milestone of the SubDAO app will be fully focussed on easy governance and is being referred to as… Easy Governance Frontend.   We are currently making improvements to the Governance Portal backend, in order to make it more robust & efficient.   We were confronted with a (D)DoS attack on the Governance Portal and collaborated with TechOps to handle the situation and implement mitigation steps   Lots of positive team updates this month, including a new fulltime dev hire      Product updates  SubDAO app The highly challenging requirements for this application (regarding resilience and extensibility) are pushing us towards a web3 tech stack that we’re less experienced with. In order to account for this fact we’re currently working on a barebones proof-of-concept application of the SubDAO app, in which we put the feasibility of our architecture design into practice. The goal is learn quickly and fail early, so that we can tweak the technical architecture design early on and have more confidence during implementation of actual end-user-facing features. In the meantime we’re also shaping the first usable milestone of the app, which will be fully focussed on Endgame governance. This ‘Easy Governance Frontend’ will allow for quick & easy delegation of MKR voting weight to governance strategies formed by voter committees and supported by delegates. This milestone is our #1 priority at this point.  Governance Portal This month @hernandoagf joined our team to work on the Governance Portal while the rest of the team focusses on Endgame-related projects. Besides small fixes & tweaks in the UI we’ve defined some backend improvements that will make the Governance Portal run more efficient and robust, so that it can run reliantly without too much attention over the coming few years. Also, last month we were faced with an alleged (D)DoS attack on the Governance Portal, which occurred just when a controversial governance poll was expiring, and temporarily disrupted the app’s performance. We collaborated with TechOps to handle the situation when it happened, conduct a root-cause analysis and define improvements to mitigate these events. We’re happy to report that the most important mitigation steps have been implemented by now. Big shoutout to the @techops-core-unit team for their response time, thoroughness and support this past month .   Team updates  New fulltime hire After an intense hiring process with quite some capable candidates, we’re happy to share the news that we hired an additional fulltime developer to help us deliver on Endgame-related projects. Héctor will be starting work in March but we’re already collaborating on his onboarding. We’re excited to have him join us and we’re confident he’ll bring a boost to the DUX dev team.  Return of unused funds February 2023 marks the start of our new budget cycle, hence we’re working to return unused funds from our previous budget cycle. DUX will return a total of 748,494.08 DAI (plus dust) to the Maker protocol via DssBlow, from our auditor wallet. Shoutout to @Dracaena27 from the SES team for helping us calculate & return the sum, and also for continuously helping us out with financial reporting matters over the past year.   New DUX baby!   We’re very happy to report that one of the DUXies was blessed with another healthy newborn DUX baby in January!    Questions or comments based on this update? Please reach out in the comments below or join our Discord server. Also note that we’ve decided to stick to this update format for now.
content.GPT-summary: The post is an update from the DUX team on their progress in January 2023. They have been working on a technical Proof-of-Concept application for the SubDAO app project, progressing with its visual and UX design, and engaging with relevant stakeholders. The post also includes updates on product development, team updates, and the return of unused funds. The post does not advertise the proposal, nor does it ask for collaboration or auditing.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: SAS Monthly Update: January 2023 Hey everyone, Welcome to our first 2023 update. As introduced last time, we do a crisp and clear format.  What happened in January?  CU Governance & Administration  Continued the repositioning of SAS to make us as productive as possible regarding Pregame and Endgame. Out of this, a few new work streams emerged in January. See in the other sections below. Evaluated different financing options as the current financing expires by End of March. Based on this evaluation, new MIPs will best posted shortly.   Endgame Mandate  Strategic  As part of the Governance Security group, members of SAS are contributing to the design of the governance security scope framework. Especially focusing on bringing in the perspective of future software development service EAs. Smart Contract Toolkit for SubDAOs: We wrote an early draft of it and conducted a few more interviews. We encountered a few practical blockers in the SC development process, which we need to resolve next. This might take some time, so this stream will have lower priority in the next month. Engaged with different stakeholders to identify opportunities to work on Eendgame-related artifacts. We will build the Switchboard Ecosystem API as part of the Powerhouse product suite that is spearheaded by SES. Based on ideas from an Endgame work group, we kicked off a new developer accessibility stream: SAS Developer Diary.   Technical  Went through a full review cycle with PE on 1inch callee and improved the contract along the way Formalized input and learnings from PE and encoded as much as possible in a dedicated linter (solhint-plugin-makerdao)  Will incorporate linter in our development process to ensure more resource-efficient review cycles in the future   Development of a second exchange-callee contract that takes advantage of the Uniswap Smart Order Router – a frontend-friendly library to compute the best exchange route using liquidity from both Uniswap v2 and Uniswap v3 liquidity sources as well as working with split routes out of the box . In comparison to the 1inch callee developed last month, this one uses less liquidity sources, but does not depend on any off-chain API and is therefore more robust. The contract and its test were published and are currently under review (see PR).   Auctions related  Pushed the development stream to package the Unified Auctions UI into a Desktop application Enabled configuration of the RPC URL via UI Released v1.0.0 of the Unified Auctions UI Desktop app  The first version doesn’t include an update strategy, yet. Users need to proactively check for newer releases and update the app accordingly. Once the update strategy is in place we will inform more broadly about the desktop app.     1304×984 71.8 KB   Outlook February  Engaging in the RFC phase of the MIPs that define the future of SAS Moving forward the Desktop App development stream with an update strategy and extension of supported wallets Extending the Unified Auctions UI and Keeper with the two new callee contracts Identify further opportunities to improve DX for protocol contributors Work on Switchboard Ecosystem API with SES Collaborating with PE, GovAlpha, and CES to further formalize the Governance Security Scope Framework

Highlights of the month    1. MakerDAO on the European Blockchain Convention  In February, we sponsored European Blockchain Convention in Barcelona, where MakerGrowth and Forge presented the Socgen case study. We also secured a prime branding spot and showcased the new design we’ve been working on.  image1368×1022 115 KB   image968×1176 117 KB  The attendees at the event came from various backgrounds, web3, web2, startups, institutes, and developers alike. The attendees were interested in learning more about what is happening at MakerDAO. In the future, we aim to get visibility in more of these events and conferences to create partnership opportunities to help. 2. Arbitrum & Optimism DAI on Coinbase  _  We are excited to announce that the DAI stablecoin is now available for deposits and withdrawals on Coinbase through Arbitrum (for eligible users) and Optimism. This integration brings faster transaction times and lower fees for Coinbase users looking to use DAI in their transactions. This integration will help drive further adoption of DAI and strengthen its position as a leading stablecoin in the DeFi ecosystem. 3. Aave D3M reactivation  The Aave Direct Deposit Module was reactivated, and the Aave D3M reactivation proposal was approved and deployed through the latest MakerDAO Executive Vote. This new Aave D3M deployment has set an initial debt ceiling of 5 million DAI and a target borrow rate of 2%. More info on this tweet. 4. ETH liquid staking derivates updates  The Maker Vaults are boooosting their available exposure to ETH liquid staking derivatives, so new parameter changes have been deployed for the Curve stETH-ETH LP, rETH and wstETH collaterals. The CRVV1ETHSTETH-A Vault went from 20mill to 100mill maximum debt ceiling, RETH-A from 5mill to 10mill maximum debt ceiling, and WSTETH-B increased its annual fee from 0.25% to 0.5%, all the mentioned changes were enabled following the Executive vote on February 27th. As always, at MakerDAO we are committed to providing our community with the latest updates and developments in the DeFi ecosystem. These updates regarding ETH liquid staking derivatives are crucial in maintaining the stability and growth of our platform. We will continue to work closely with our partners and community members to ensure that MakerDAO remains a leading stablecoin in the DeFi ecosystem. Stay tuned for more updates and developments in the near future.  General updates     Business development     Kado: Kado, an on/off ramp, added DAI support and bridging to Arbitrum via Lifi   Ant Alpha update: Ant Alpha generated another 20mill. DAI with their crvETHSETH-A Vault in February, as they’ve been increasing their position, we will keep close track of their Vault situation alongside Risk CU. Exactly: Exactly is a DeFi protocol for depositing and borrowing crypto assets with variable and fixed interest rates. You can read more about what we did with them in the Marketing Activations Section below. Juno Finance update: Recently, Juno Finance added Dai on Debit Card and got MKR listed for Buy/Sell as well. Planing co-marketing   Osmosis PSM: Osmosis Zone DEX activate their first incentives pool with DAI on it, check more in the Marketing Activations Section below. Timeless_Fi: are the creators of Timeless and Bunni, two open-source and non-custodial yield markets and liquidity engine protocols, check more about our partnership in the Marketing Activations Section below.   Marketing and communication     Top tweets of the month     First tweet of the DeFi protocols joint campaign - 232k impressions  Explanatory tweet about Maker and frontends - 132k impressions  Chainlink Automation onboarded in the Maker Keeper Network - 53k impressions  Joint tweet with Element Finance - 50k impressions  Why DAI is your stablecoin of choice? - 50k impressions   Top LinkedIn posts     Layer-2 solutions for DAI - 6k impressions  ETH liquid staking derivates poll - 5.4k impressions  RWA Report by Strategic Finance Core Unit - 3k impressions  100M DAI on Arbitrum  - 2.6k impressions  DeFi Protocols Joint Campaign  - 2k impressions   Monthly Twitter report   New followers: 3,499 Monthly Impressions: 1,471,364 Monthly Engagements: 38,571 Avg Engagement Rate: 2.9%    Recently published articles and PR releases    OlympusDAO Votes To Deposit $77M In MakerDAO - The Defiant MakerDAO Integrates Chainlink Automation To Enhance DAI’s Financial Stability - PR Newswire   Marketing activations and speaker sessions    What does DAI’s future hold post-BUSD? MakerDAO joins the Coinjournal Podcast   The CoinJournal Podcast - What does DAI’s future hold post-BUSD? MakerDAO joins the CoinJournal podcast  Bitcoin Insider - What does DAI’s future hold post-BUSD? MakerDAO joins the CoinJournal podcast  Youtube - What does DAI’s future hold post-BUSD? MakerDAO joins the CoinJournal podcast    The Daily Forkast - Lenders in the crypto sector are optimistic about DeFi’s recovery this year – but why is that?  Forkast News Youtube - DeFi recovery soon? | Crypto News | The Daily Forkast    Timeless_Fi  The stablecoin pair DAI/USDC has the highest rewards on the liquidity engine Bunni.pro, which Timeless_Fi built for Uniswap V3. Holders of the veLIT token can vote to determine the amount of $oLIT liquidity incentives each pool will receive. Check our tweet with more info here. Osmosis DEX stableswap pool  The very first stableswap pool with incentives on Osmosis is alive, and is DAI / CMST / IST. Find out more in Growth’s Twitter thread. Idlefinance  The idleDAI yield got boosted, now deposits are routed among Aave, Compound and Euler Senior Tranches to seek the best APY available! See the info on Idle Finance’s tweet. Chainlink Automation  Following the ratification poll for Onboard Chainlink Automation in the Maker Keeper Network on January 9th. Chainlink was completely added to the stated Maker Keeper Network, now Chainlink will also help Maker to maintain our Vaults safe! Here’s a little thread about this subject. Exactly Protocol ≡ started to offer variable and fixed interest rates for DAI on its lending venue, at the same time, check our Twitter thread on how it works.    Transparency Dashboard   Although the Forum is where the Maker Community can find information about CUs, with all the flow of information, sometimes it’s hard to find all you want to know about the Growth CU. As a response to that, and as a preparation for the SES transparency tool, we created a public Notion where you will find all about our CU:  Finance Dashboard: Budget and expenses Business Development Dashboard: closed integrations Twitter Dashboard: Impression, followers, and engagement Marketing and PR Dashboard: Campaigns and press releases Brand analysts Key highlights Link to our updates in the forum let us know your thoughts @Recognized-Delegates    We want to hear from you    Share your thoughts, feedback or tips with us in the comments below. Please use this link if you prefer to engage with us anonymously.

In short   In February we finished work on the technical proof-of-concept application for the SubDAO app project, which left us feeling confident about our stack and optimistic about building resilient frontends using web3 tech.   Right now we’re working on designing & developing the Easy Governance Frontend (EGF) which is slated for launch in pregame. In parallel we’re coordinating with other teams and stakeholders to figure out how Maker’s governance and delegation needs to change in light of Endgame (ie. Sagittarius Engine, governance strategies, CVCs, etc.)   We started our first team offsite of the year, scheduled around the ETHDenver conference.   Wrapping up work on the Governance Portal API work to make it more robust and efficient—we’ll deploy the changes after the Endgame Constitution MIP poll concludes.   Took some security measures for the Governance Portal, in light of the upcoming controversial Endgame Constitution MIP poll—we’re expecting a lot of traffic for this one.     Product updates  SubDAO app Earlier this year we started work on a technical proof-of-concept application to prove the feasibility of the app’s architecture design. Last month we finished that milestone and shared it with some individuals across relevant CUs and stakeholder groups. Right now we feel confident about building the EGF and SubDAO app based on our selected stack/designed architecture. For clarify; the EGF (Easy Governance Frontend) is a first workking milestone of the SubDAO app and will be made available as a separate app. Currently we’re progressing on the UI/UX design and technical development of the app. Over the past few weeks we’ve slowly started sharing progress and sneak-previews with select stakeholders throughout the DAO. We can’t wait to share some designs once certain Endgame mechanisms are designed/confirmed. Okay, here’s one little sneak preview    Screenshot 2023-03-09 at 14.17.591478×1156 155 KB  In parallel we’ve coordinated with Rune and other core units in order to understand the design of the Sagittarius Engine and required changes to MakerDAO’s vote delegation system. We’re actively contributing to this process since the on-chain components will be very influential to the UX of the EGF.  Governance Portal Earlier this year Hernando joined our team to work on the Governance Portal whilst the rest of the team focusses on Endgame-related projects. Hernando recently finished work on the Governance Portal API and app to make it more robust and efficient in terms of handling governance data. We decided to push back the deployment of these updates until later this month, after the Endgame Constitution MIP poll closes. On that same topic; since the Endgame Constitution MIP poll seems highly controversial and high-profile we’ve collaborated with TechOps Core Unit to define some additional measures to protect the Governance Portal from attacks and keep it running amidst traffic peaks:   We’re increasing the frequency of automated testing   We’re introducing high-attention timeframes for both teams—during these times both teams are extra attentive of the Governance Portal performance and availability (incl its dependencies)   We’ve created a new channel on the MakerDAO Discord server called  voting-support, where any issues can be reported.   Later this week we’ll share documentation on how to manually vote using Etherscan, in any scenario where the Governance Portal becomes temporarily unavailable. We’ll do everything we can to keep it running      Team updates  ETHDenver offsite    Last month we started our first team offsite of the year. Besides spending quality bonding time with the team we had some goals for the offsite. Primarily; defining and breaking down work related to the EGF and SubDAO app, which is best done in person. We also set out to coordinate with other teams and stakeholders—we met with people from GovAlpha, PE, SES, the Ecosystem Scope, some delegates, and more! The focus was mostly on the Sagittarius Engine, changes to delegation and the EGF. Last but not least we got inspired and energized by the ETHDenver conferences, and we were able to build our relationship with protocol/tooling teams that we rely on (eg. Alchemy, MetaMask, Hats Protocol)  Philip back from paternal leave   We’re happy to report Phil is now the dad of a heathy newborn, and he’s slowly getting back into gear. Right now I’m feeling very good about our team—we’re in a good shape right now! I’m feeling proud and grateful to be working with a fun and talented team    Questions or comments based on this update? Please reach out in the comments below or join our Discord server.
content.GPT-summary: The post is an update on the progress of the DUX team's work on the SubDAO app and the Easy Governance Frontend (EGF), as well as their coordination with other teams and stakeholders on changes to MakerDAO's governance and delegation system. The post also includes updates on the Governance Portal and the team's recent offsite. The post does not advertise the proposal, but rather explains the team's progress and invites questions and comments.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: SAS Monthly Update: February 2023 Hey everyone, Welcome to our crisp and clear February 2023 update.  What happened in February?  CU Governance & Administration  Repositioned CU to become a trusted custom software development service and to acquire as many project-based funded MakerDAO projects as possible. This is reflected in the proposed mandate adjustment and rebranding into Sidestream Automation Services (SAS) and the team’s role in the Ecosystem Scope. Published new budget proposal to finance CU operations. The core idea is to rely on project-based funds whenever possible.   Endgame Mandate  Enablement  Continued contribution of SAS members to the design of the governance security scope framework. Especially focusing on bringing in the perspective of a future software development service Ecosystem Actor. Smart Contract Toolkit for SubDAOs: Created a first UI mockup to further conceptualize the product idea. Given some practical blockers in Maker’s current Smart Contract development process, we timebox the time spent on this work stream to not waste resources… Started conversations with different stakeholders to source more software project opportunities in the Maker universe (e.g. UI for Dai bridge). If you hear of any software development opportunities in the Maker universe, please let us know.   Execution  Got 1inch-based exchange callee merged into the exchange-callee repository in close collaboration with PE (see PR) Kicked off Switchboard Ecosystem API development  gathered requirements for full project as well as more detailed requirements for first phase (see issue) kicked off development: initialised repo, added org-members, figured out permissions, added linting, testing, … started to work on first features: authentication, db models added, orm initialization etc.     Auctions related  Refactored code base to accommodate the new exchange callees Released v1.18.0 of the Unified Auction UI including an update to the desktop app  New app image creation (for all major OS) is now part of the CI/CD pipeline Automated update strategy for existing app users     Outlook March  Finish MVP of Switchboard Ecosystem API Get next exchange callee merged into the exchange-callee repository Integrate two new callees to Unified Auction UI Identify further endgame-related development work opportunities
